Two bills passed in the Michigan Senate: Gretchen Whitmer's authority to impose a state of emergency.
As of April 29: neither bill had passed the state House of Representatives.
Gov: Whitmer has stated that she will veto any legislation that restricts executive power during the coronavirus pandemic.
The claim that Gov: Whitmer's emergency powers have been stripped is false, as the bills have only passed the Senate and have not become law.
